thread.title: Bank stocks fall as RBI keeps lending rate unchanged | India News
thread.title_full: Bank stocks fall as RBI keeps lending rate unchanged | India News - Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Bank stocks fall as RBI keeps lending rate unchanged | India News
text:
NEW DELHI: Bank stocks witnessed selling pressure today as the scrips fell up to 4% after the Reserve Bank kept the key policy rates unchanged. 

Shares of Punjab National Bank dipped 3.68%, Bank of Baroda lost 2.58%, AXIS Bank went down by 2.19%, SBI lost 1.62% and Kotak Mahindra Bank 1.55% on BSE. 

Led by the losses in these stocks, the BSE bank index was trading 0.55% down at 23,186.39 during the fag-end of the trade. 

The benchmark BSE sensex also plunged over 180 points soon after the policy announcement. 

The 30-share index later pared some of the losses but was still trading in the negative at 28,286.68 points in pre-close session, down by 48.48 points or 0.17% over the previous close. 

For the second time in a row, the Reserve bank today opted for a status quo in its key rates but shifted the stance of the monetary policy from 'accommodative' to 'neutral'. 

Accordingly, the repo rate at which it lends to the system stands at 6.25% and the reverse repo rate at which it absorbs excess liquidity is also retained at 5.75%.
